title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
What is Quarto?

Reproducible Publishing System based on Pandoc
One format, many outputs

Website
Publications
Books
Dashboards

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
.qmd files

Short for quarto markdown
Decoupled from RStudio IDE

plugins for VSCode, JupyterLab and RStudio are available

Can still Render within RStudio
Render with quarto standalone on command line:

quarto render my_document.qmd

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Cross Language Support

Supports a number of languages:

R
Python
Julia
Observable

Can interchange between langugages using Apache Arrow

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Jupyter Notebook Support

Jupyter Notebooks are cross compatible
One command to interchange:

quarto convert notebook.ipynb
Fast way to publish Jupyter Notebooks!

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Code Output Freezing

By default, code is not recomputed
quarto render --execute will recompute
Output is “frozen”

execute:
  freeze: auto  # re-render only when source changes

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Code Chunks
Options are moved to within the code chunk using #| (hash-pipe) for each line

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
RMarkdown
```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(DT)
library(ggimage)
```

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Quarto
```{r}
#| label = "setup",
#| include = FALSE
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(DT)
library(ggimage)
```

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
section: How is Quarto different from RMarkdown?
text:
How is Quarto different from RMarkdown?

Standardized YAML across formats
Decoupled from RStudio
More consistent presentation across formats
Tab Panels
Code Highlighting

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Should I Switch to Quarto?

Should you switch to Quarto? Not necessarily. If you find R Markdown meet your need, you can definitely stay there. It is not imperative to switch. Quarto’s goal is to cover most features of R Markdown eventually, but it may be impossible to become a strict superset of R Markdown. - Yihui Xie



https://yihui.org/en/2022/04/quarto-r-markdown/

text:

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Tabsets

CodeFigure


This is where I would put some code:
```{r}
library(palmerpenguins)
library(ggplot2)
data(penguins)
ggplot(penguins, aes(x=bill_depth_mm, y=bill_length_mm, color = species)) + geom_point()
```

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Code Highlighting

Incremental highlighting (line by line)
Killer app for me
Really good for teaching!

```{r}
#| echo: TRUE
#| eval: FALSE
#| code-line-numbers: "3|4-6|7"
library(palmerpenguins)
library(ggplot2)
data(penguins)
ggplot(penguins) + aes(x=bill_depth_mm, 
                       y=bill_length_mm, 
                       color = species) + 
  geom_point()
```

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Code Highlighting Example

library(palmerpenguins)
library(ggplot2)
data(penguins)
ggplot(penguins) + aes(x=bill_depth_mm, 
                       y=bill_length_mm, 
                       color = species) + 
  geom_point()

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Checklist

Start a Quarto Project
For your documents: Change your output: to the corresponding format: in your YAML
Use knitr::convert_chunk_header() to convert your code blocks (outputs a .qmd file)
Render your files
For websites: edit your _quarto.yml file if necessary

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
1. Start a Quarto Project


File > New Project > New Directory > Quarto Project




Quarto Project Start

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
2. Convert your Rmarkdown Documents

Change your YAML header
Instead of output:, use format:

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
---
title: "Quarto/RMarkdown - What's Different?"
author: Ted Laderas
subtitle: FCT Abuja useR Group
date: 9/15/2022
output:
  xaringan::moon_reader:
    lib_dir: libs
    css: xaringan-themer.css
---

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
---
title: "Quarto/RMarkdown - What's Different?"
author: Ted Laderas
subtitle: FCT Abuja useR Group
date: 9/15/2022
format: 
  revealjs:
    self-contained: true
    theme: night
    footer: <https://laderast.github.io/qmd_rmd/>
incremental: false
highlight-style: github
---

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
2. RMarkdown/Quarto Formats



RMarkdown
Quarto




output: html_document
format: html


output: pdf_document
format: pdf


output: word_document
format: docx


output: xaringan
format: revealjs


output: ioslides
format: revealjs


output: distill
Quarto Article Layout





https://quarto.org/docs/faq/rmarkdown.html

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
3. Convert your RMarkdown Code Chunks
knitr::convert_chunk_header() will convert your RMarkdown code chunks into quarto compatible format.
knitr::convert_chunk_header("filename.Rmd", 
    output = "filename.qmd")

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
3. Converting Code Chunks

Original ChunkConverted Chunk


```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(DT)
library(ggimage)
```


```{r}
#| label = "setup",
#| include = FALSE
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(DT)
library(ggimage)
```

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
4. Render your files (on CLI)
quarto render .

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
5. Update your _quarto.yml for websites

Controls navigation and visibility of documents




_quarto.yml

project:
  type: website

website:
  title: "Ted Laderas, PhD"
  description: "Ted's R and Teaching Blog"
  navbar:
    right:
      - teaching.qmd
      - articles.rmd
      - blog.qmd
      - talks.qmd
      - notebook.ipynb #works for Jupyter notebooks!

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Publish your files (on CLI)
quarto publish can push and update a number of different kinds of webhosts. You will need credentials to publish to each of these.
quarto publish gh-pages    # GitHub Pages
quarto publish quarto-pub  # Quarto.pub 
quarto publish netlify     # Netlify
quarto publish connect     # RStudio Connect


https://quarto.org/docs/publishing/

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Conclusions

Quarto supports multiple languages / IDEs
Quarto standardizes a lot of outputs
Does a better job of one document, many outputs
Lots of publishing features (references, figures, etc.)

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Learn More
Workshop materials from Andrew Bray: https://github.com/rstudio-conf-2022/rmd-to-quarto

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Observable + Shiny + Quarto

Rapid prototyping of responsive dashboards
Uses Observable for front end
Uses Shiny reactives for backend
Quarto for Layout



https://laderast.github.io/qmd_rmd/

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
4. Render your files


Via RStudio GUI

Render button in RStudio

quarto::quarto_render()`

Via Command Line
quarto render <filename>

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
4. Render via RStudio GUI

Render button in RStudio

quarto::quarto_render()`

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
4. Render via Command Line
> quarto render <filename>

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Mix and Match Formats



_quarto.yml

website:
  title: "Ted Laderas, PhD"
  description: "Ted's R and Teaching Blog"
  navbar:
    right:
      - teaching.qmd
      - articles.rmd
      - blog.qmd
      - talks.qmd
      - notebook.ipynb

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Freeze Results and avoid recomputing

Creates a freeze/ directory in your project
Saves intermediate output




_quarto.yml

project:
  title: "qmd_rmd"
  type: website
  output-dir: docs
  
freeze: true

title: Quarto/RMarkdown - What’s Different?
text:
Freeze Results: CLI

Results are frozen with quarto render by default.
Use --execute to recompute:


quarto render . --execute
